title: World Rugby under fire as Sergio Parisse blasts 'ridiculous' call to cancel New Zealand vs Italy: 'If All Blacks needed to win it would not have been cancelled'
text:
World Rugby has been accused of double standards by aggrieved Italy captain Sergio Parisse who believes that if it had been the All Blacks that needed to beat the Azzurri in their final Pool B match, the game would have gone ahead instead of being cancelled thereby leading to Italy’s elimination.

On a day of furious recrimination that saw Scotland hint at disputing tournament regulations if their match against Japan in Yokohama on Sunday did not take place, it was the sight of Italian hooker Leonardo Ghiraldini breaking down in tears after morning training in Toyota City as he was told that he would be denied his last ever appearance for his country that encapsulated the sadness, the confusion...
description: World Rugby has been accused of double standards by aggrieved Italy captain Sergio Parisse who believes that if it had been the All Blacks that needed to beat the Azzurri in their final Pool B match, the game would have gone ahead instead of being cancelled thereby leading to Italy’s elimination.
